Reviews.Title: A truly extraordinary little camera
Reviews.Author: Tabulrasa
Reviews.Content: I am about to travel around the world and want an alternative to my Pentax K10D, particularly when wishing to be unobtrusive in third-world countries.  First, I spent some time with the Panasonic LX2 -- same camera as the Leica at less than half the price -- which has some unique features and seems to be a terrific camera.  BUT it won't go into a shirt pocket because the marvelous Leica lens protrudes.  At a hefty (!) 7.8 oz, it weighs 56% more than the Optio Z10's 5 oz.  The Optio is so small that there is nothing to hold onto.  The Panasonic is better in that respect, but significantly bulkier.I had just about decided to send both cameras back when I realized that I hadn't even looked at the few pix I had taken with the Optio.  So I duly transferred them to my Mac and was absolutely astonished by the results. For reasons I don't understand, the Optio seems to handle subtle shades in the sky and clouds better than the K10.The bottom line: The Optio produces razor-sharp pictures, even when using the 7x zoom hand-held at a slow shutter speed.  Given some of the negative comments in these pages, I really didn't expect that.  The design of the camera is superb.  I only wish there were some semblance of a grip to hold onto.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio Z-10
Reviews.Author: Mike "'ol Bell Labs/Weco Guy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. You can use the Auto but I prefer to use the Green mode where you can set the settings as in my SRT 101 35MM camera. I took a outdoor shot of a veined flower, about 8 inches away. It came out extremely detailed, and trust me I'm pickey. I then used the stitch mode where you can create a 'Digital wide angle' it also worked great. The feature of the lens that uses a refraction mirror to go from wide angle to close is great as you never get the lens protruding from the camera. The features in this camera are plentiful and you can use them to get really fantastic pictures. Read up on this camera and compare for yourself, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Maxim V. Belkin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of its huge optical zoom, 8 MP, new mirror optics and because it is Pentax. And this camera is absolutely great! The pictures are very juicy in color and clear! Nothing moves when you zoom - only mirrors inside the camera! It's true that the camera marks easily, but it can be easily cleaned! The Menu is very easy to read, with helping tips about each mode of shooting - a great plus for me since I don't like to read the manual. However there was one thing that frightened me and I did read the manual - if you press several times Ok-button - histogram will appear and if you want to shoot something that has spots which are very dark and very light - they will appear as yellow and red spots on the LCD display! In the beginning that made me think the LCD or camera itself is damaged. But - it's actually the way it's supposed to work!!! And now I think this is very useful tool! O! btw, to turn the camera on - you should move the plastic piece that covers lenses on front - tricky to understand but easy to do!So I'm completely satisfied with this purchase. That's why I give this camera 5 stars. A great camera in style!!!

Reviews.Title: If you like picture noise, buy the Pentax Optio Z10
Reviews.Author: JRH "j5094"
Reviews.Content: This camera has speed settings from ISO 64 to 3200. Of these, only 64 and 100 are acceptable. In bright scenes you will get a picture with good detail and color and a small amount of noise.  Even at these low settings, a slightly magnified image will show noise as a speckling in the image. I made a mistake buying this camera - somehow misunderstanding its characteristics before I bought it. If you do not believe me, then read the professional reviews, such as at [...]The good - It's compact, has a 7x optical zoom, has a nice screen, easy to use controls, and takes adequate movies.The bad - It takes low quality noisy pictures, it has no image stabilization. Pentax claims it has image stabilization, but what they really do is increase the ISO level, reduce the exposure time, and greatly increase the noise level. You will get this effect whenever you take zoom pictures, except in the brightest of sunlight.My recommendation:  Do not buy this camera!  If you want a small high zoom camera that takes good movies, but has better noise characteristics, look at the very similar looking Casio with real image stabilization.  Pentax certainly could do better.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for anyone!
Reviews.Author: M. Deans
Reviews.Content: I have several Pentax cameras (digital and 35mm) and I find that they are truly built to last and are as user friendly as they possibly can be.  This camera is my quickie pocket camera and has proven itself worthy of the Pentax name.  The buttons are simple, intuitive and easy to read for any digital camera this size.  The zoom is awesome, but I usually don't go past the 7x optical because the digital zoom is like most digital zooms, grainy.  It isn't the fastest between shots, but it's usually fast enough even for sports, kids and pet action.  It shoots nice little videos with decent sounds quality too.  I have dropped this camera several times on hard surfaces, used it in rain and snow, and even dropped it in some water once and it still works great.  The LCD viewer is like all LCDs in the sun, a little hard to see, but I find that the photos always turn out better back home than they looked on the LCD.  Bottom line, for $200, this is a great, great camera.  I wouldn't have been upset paying $300 for it.

Reviews.Title: My fourth Pentax
Reviews.Author: Peter S. Clark "Buildgreenman"
Reviews.Content: I didn't go looking for another Pentax. I bought a new laptop, which came with Windows Vista. The upshot was that I could no longer download photos from my old Pentax Optio. So I did my homework, looking for a lot of optical zoom, lots of pixels, big LCD screen, small package (I loved how the old Pentax fit into an Altoids box), small price. This one came out on top, so I bought it sight unseen. It is a wonderful camera, has amazing zoom capabilites, has anti-shake software and takes great time exposures/night shots. The battery lasts a long time and the camera feels great in the hand. My only complaint is that blues are too, well, blue! I love the camera and always carry it with me.

Reviews.Title: Dream cam. 7x zoom in your pocket.
Reviews.Author: JR "Carioca"
Reviews.Content: Great bargain. I love my new Pentax. The zoom is great and the camera fits in my shirt pocket, perfect combination. Battery life is fantastic, the best battery life I've ever seen.Pros: 8MP, 7x (very nice zoom, great idea for such a small camera), size is perfect for travel or just fun events, battery life.Cons: Just a minor thing, it took a bit of time to get used to holding due to it's small size. At first you feel like your fingers are in the way. Definitely worth getting used to.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MELA
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a camera with more zoom,I was hoping for at least 10, but all the cameras I looked at were so big. I came upon thePentax and decided to give it a try. Could not be happier,this camera isso easy and having the lense covered is great.Can carry in my purse or pocket.  7x zoom is plenty for me at this stage of my picture taking. Don't hesitate on buying this camera!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera!
Reviews.Author: MB lover
Reviews.Content: I have had a number of good point and shoot digitals and enjoyed them, but hated the lag time. This camera all but does away with that! I even took sports shots of my grandkids and got the "on the move!"I like the shake reduction feature because I was shooting in low light a lot of times and needed it. Also, the night time and closeup features worked much better than my old Pentax, even though it was a great camera.My only complaint is that in high light it is impossible to see the image on the screen, and I discovered immediately that I could not take vertical pictures with my sunglasses on because they are polarized.Otherwise, it's a great little camera!!

Reviews.Title: A MASTERPIECE
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: This really is a remarkable camera. The moving-mirror zoom is one of those ideas which makes you wonder why somebody did not think of it and implement it sooner and works well. Picture quality is impressive and the quality of the colour is fantastic. And all at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Grainy indoor pictures
Reviews.Author: Andrew Anderson "speckletrout"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a saleswoman who really sounded like she knew what she was talking about.  She said that it was simply the best point and shoot camera on the market.  I bought the storyline and made the purchase without going to other stores, professionals, or reading online reviews.I thought the functionality of the camera was wonderful.  However, when I printed out the pictures all of the indoor ones looked extremely grainy.  The outdoor pictures were bright and clear but nothing from indoors. It was also difficult to get a picture that wasn't blurry.I took the camera back and bought a Sony W90.  I took similar photos (with similar objects, light etc.) and printed the pictures.  Sony was clearly the better camera.I would not recommend this camera.  The functionality is great but the quality of the pictures is poor.

Reviews.Title: Black Cat, White Dog, yummy
Reviews.Author: mil aves
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year.  It is compact, (easy to carry in a purse or pocket), looks great, and has an interesting approach to auto settings; for example, it has a setting for "food," and separate settings for dark-colored/light-colored dogs, as well as dark-colored/light-colored cats.  There are undoubtedly more auto settings than any single person would ever use.Still, if you want to have some fun, go and shoot some "food."  I learned the easy/hard way that if you do this in a restaurant, the chef may come running out of the kitchen to find out (a) what is wrong with your dinner, or (b) what newspaper you work for.These are my problems with the camera:It has no viewfinder, but of course I knew that when I bought it.  Since it was my first digital point-and-shoot, I didn't realize how important that detail would be.  In bright light it is very hard to see the image on the screen.  On the beach during a trip to Hawaii, I was reduced to point-guess-shoot.The shutter button is not ergonomically designed, and it is very easy to jiggle the camera while trying to fit your finger down into the recess of the shutter release.  This surprised me; I have a small hand. My next camera will have a shutter button that sits slightly above the frame of the camera.In that vein, the toggle for the zoom function is hard to use without shifting your grip of the camera.As a result of the clunkiness, some of my still life photos are blurry, because I jiggled the camera while depressing the shutter release.  Other photos that should have been "zoomed" were not, because I would have had to move the camera away from my shot to do the zoom.Picture resolution is so-so.  From dazzling to pretty good if you do not want to enlarge the photo beyond its initial size, but not so good if you do your enlarging in PhotoShop or a similar program.  One person I've talked with says "megapixels" are the thing, and another say "optics."  Supposedly, this camera has both.The shuttler lag time seems very long, but I have to say I am accustomed to using a DSLR with no evident shuttler lag at all.  I did some shooting with a CoolPix, just to compare, and indeed, the Pentax is slower.  I've missed a lot of shots.The camera has poor auto-focus under lower light conditions.My best shots using this camera have been outdoor scenery or tourist photos, low to normal daylight.  My worst shots are those where there is little contrast, those where the camera went into digital zoom, and those  I wanted to enlarge and/or to crop and isolate details.New, it cost me about $200 at a discount store.  As now priced (<$100) it is a nice buy and probably a good enough camera for almost anybody who wants high pixels with optics from a great company, many years in the camera business.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio Z10
Reviews.Author: Don Darling
Reviews.Content: The only problem I see with this camera is that in bright conditions outside you cannot see the screen or picture you are taking.  Most cameras have done away with the little viewfinder; it sure would be nice to have one.Other than that, this camera is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, much maligned
Reviews.Author: Samuel D. Thomas "sd thomas"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to even order this camera, given the not just negative, but virulent reviews I read from some of the reviewers.  However, I was attracted by the many advertised features of this camera being sold for such a low price.  I ordered it and found the well written instruction booklet (a half inch thick) to allow easy mastery of the camera.  I don't believe many of the reviewers have either knowledge of the digital camera concept... or even bothered to read the instructions.  This is an excellent camera which has more features than any I've ever owned.  If you pay attention to how to operate it, you won't find a nicer camera and certainly not at the price offered.  This ain't no Brownie Hawkeye!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Pictures are so grainy!
Reviews.Author: Susan A. Faneuf "Susiefan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the size, price, and the way the lense worked.  I used it for a while before leaving my review.  I am so disappointed with the quality of picture coming from this camera.  I tried to take some pictures indoors with and without flash.  They were grainy looking.  My daughter used a Kodak camera at the same event and her pics were fantastic.  I then tried to tell myself that it would just have to be my "outdoor" camera that I used in high light situations.  Well, took it to the beach and got the same results. I am really sorry that I bought this camera.  Thinking of giving it to the grandchild to play with!  I have used Kodak, Canon, Nikon small digital cameras before with wonderful results.  I also own a Canon EOS Rebel.  This Pentax is the worst by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Swallow
Reviews.Content: My new Pentax Optio Z10 at 8 megaixels is absolutely fantastic. So easy to use, carry,focus and get completely good clear results. The expanded movie mode is particularly good with great ease of use and playback. So far I love it.

Reviews.Title: It's really about taking pictures.
Reviews.Author: John Clark
Reviews.Content: In my younger days, I was a professional photographer. Of course there are cameras for taking superb pictures. Want to hoist around a tripod, perhaps a view camera, an umbrella, interchangeable lenses, lights? Hey, what happened to the landscape or the people or the big game?  Changed, or disappeared, or wouldn't behave, or stay still, or game over.  And driving in my car, wait, there's a once-in-a-lifetime chance to get that special shot, maybe sell it to a newspaper.  So I carry it around in my shirt pocket, hit the "green" button which defaults to standard automatic mode, and click the shot. Did you get it too? Oh, you didn't have your camera handy at the time?  Or it was deep in your bag and anyway, the lens sticks out? This won't happen with the Optio Z10. And the picture quality far exceeds what you can get on a cell phone. And instead of a view-finder, I can show a picture to family and friends, and strangers, instantly on the big display screen. Then they can approve the likeness (or order you to delete it - that gains trust!).  And it records sound for 24 hours continuous if you want. And makes legal quality prints with dates. Check the manual (essential information), it does incredible things, but you need a bit of photo knowledge to read the settings. Practice automatic ability to make quick manual adjustments, and you can fix things to get rid of the problems others found. Now I won't go out without it, like those credit cards and house and car keys and cellphone. It's called "portability", the most important attribute for a point-and-shoot, in my book.4/20/2012 UPDATE: Oops. Now we have the IPhone4s, which I  just bought. The above review, while still valid, becomes somewhat irrelevant. The picture quality and screen size is every bit as good as the above point-and-shoot, maybe better. And is much more likely to be with you at all times, because it's your cell phone too. Still learning how to use it. Very exciting stuff, we're into a new world now.

Reviews.Title: Got mine new for under $100
Reviews.Author: JANA
Reviews.Content: I bought the z10 to carry in my purse. I like its convenience but am not thrilled with the picture quality. Outside shots aren't too bad but inside shots tend to be grainy. I bought mine here on Amazon for less than $100 so the $300+ price tag I am seeing right now is absurd.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann Stryker "JAS"
Reviews.Content: I love my Pentax Optio Z10, it is small easy to travel with.  I love how you just slide the lens cover to turn on and off.  takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: R. B. Severson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money. It was extremely easy to figure out all of the options, and I am sure that anyone who is somewhat used to digital cameras would agree. I love the zoom!

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Emotal Soul "Danielle"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this camera. I own a Pentax digital SLR so of course when it came time to get a point & shoot, I went with trusty Pentax. I love the 7x zoom and 8 mega pixels is more than enough for a point & shoot. It's so much smaller that it appears in the pictures (which is good). I highly recommend this camera. It's becoming discontinued  because new models are coming out (this one is much better), so hurry!

Reviews.Title: Great Quality!
Reviews.Author: Little Bit
Reviews.Content: The auto-picture scan is a great feature and usually chooses the best way to  get the optimal picture quality for each snapshot. Durable and user-friendly, the Optio Z10 is a great make by Pentax. I especially appreciate the mirrored zoom, so the lens doesn't have the chance to get stuck while focusing upon an object. Good for beginners and intermediate photographers. Not your typical point-and-shoot, especially with the 7X optical. Also appreciate the equally clear picture quality even when zoomed to the maximum capacity. Would recommend at once to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Pleased customer
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for everyday needs.  I bought this camera a couple months ago and I was so pleased with my purchase that I bought another one for my mother (her first digital camera).  I chose this camera because of how easy it is to use.  The menus are easy to navigate and you can do almost anything on this camera by just pressing a single button (throw away pictures, review pictures, etc.).  I will admit that sometimes the picture comes out blurry even with the shake reduction, but for the price you can't expect a professional quality camera.  It is a great deal and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is just looking for a nice camera with high zoom to take everyday pictures.

Reviews.Title: Big quality from a little camera
Reviews.Author: Don Apgar "Bargain Boy"
Reviews.Content: Our Pentax is a replacement for a previous one we had gotten last year, which got damaged in a collision with a closing car door.  We didn't even consider another brand or model, we were so pleased with the picture quality, size and the 7x zoom.  It's the perfect camera for us.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: Had a previous version of a Pentax Optio so I am familiar with their design. Lots of impromements over the previous version. Picture quality is superb, and lots of new options for taking pictures. All in all a great camera choice for around $100.00.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Rex B. Conaway
Reviews.Content: What a nice little camera,so far every picture I have taken day or night,inside or outside has been outstanding. Its very easy to use right out of the box,I have not tried all the bells and whistles on the camera yet,but for basic picture taking its great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: EOD Tech "Just waiting for the coming zombie ...
Reviews.Content: I've only been using this camera in Kuwait and Iraq, as that's my current location, so I can't rate it on how it does in the mountains and whatnot. The reason I picked this camera was because it had a 7x zoom without a retractable lense (there's lots of sand storms out here) so I wouldn't have to worry so much about dust.  Allow me to start of with the good notes. First and foremost, price! Just barely over 100 dollars is pretty cheap for a decent digital camera. Second, there are tons of features on this camera. Almost a con, because there are so many, sometimes I just want to take a picture and have it come out well. One really great feature is that you can turn the megapixels down from 8, all the way to 1.3.  This is great for e-mail quality, and unless you are going to print a poster, 3 megapixels is actually plenty. Third, the battery will last you all day long as well, which is very nice. Fourth, it works on a mac! And Finally, the video. The video is very good. Not quite 300 dollar camcorder good, but I have been able to capture good videos of explosions and the like.  Now for the cons. Yes, the camera does have a 7x optical zoom. However, the zoom is only slightly better then a digital zoom. I think this will probably be the only model pentax sells that will have the mirrored zoom. Second, is image quality. You might get lucky with the auto mode select, but chances are that you will not. If you have patience, then you can fiddle with the camera quite a bit to get your picture to come out well (that is, not grainy) The trouble is that you can't really tell how grainy the picture is by the LCD screen, so I would recommend taking several pictures with several separate settings, providing you have the patience, and time to do so.  There are other smaller pros and cons to the camera, but it will be a waste of time to list them all. The down and dirty is simply that it's a cheap camera, which will give you decent pictures, as long as you have the time to make all the proper adjustments. I wouldn't recommend taking this camera as your only point and shoot on a vacation spot that you will not visit again. However, if you just want something to take with you camping, a fun day at the park, or Christmas morning, the camera will get the job done. I would HIGHLY recommend this camera for a teenager, because most teens don't care if their pictures are a little bit fuzzy, plus the camera is nice and cheep.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: F. Schlosser
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera and I love it!  The pictures turned out great.  Its easy to use and the 7X zoom is such a nice feature.  The price was just right, too.

Reviews.Title: Pentaz Optio Z10
Reviews.Author: Dubbie Dubblyoo
Reviews.Content: Flawless performance for years now and I take a lot of pictures. The battery still recharges well. Picture quality is great. the Price was right. Best feature is the fact that the lense does not project from the camera when zooming out. Makes it easy to take pix undetected. Slide cover keeps lens protected. Drawback is that it's so small that its hard to hold, but I overcame the situation by attaching a tripod base to it. This allows for a good grip, and lets the camera stand upright on a surface for unattended pix and videos.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Penny Logston
Reviews.Content: has been a good buy and is still good for the intended use very compact and easy to use should be good for a long time

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Good Value
Reviews.Author: C. McCloud
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement camera for our foreign exchange student who broke hers.  Just what she was looking for, and good value.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: R. C. Gonzales
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with Pentax products. I had an A10, and I was really happy with it. But I cracked the LCD screen so I just bought another camera. This Z10 was it. It's small, easy to use and good picture quality for my personal purposes. I'd give it 5 stars, but the plastic casing is not as nice as my old A10, but the sliding cover to power on is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: Small, great picture quality, affordable
Reviews.Author: J. Overton
Reviews.Content: THIS IS MY 4TH PURCHASE OF THIS CAMERA.  I HAVE GIVEN IT TO MY TEENAGE GRANDCHILDREN AND THEY LOVE IT, AS DO I.  THE EASE TO OPERATE, THE GREAT PICTURE QUALITY, AND THE PRICE MAKE THIS A GIFT THAT KEEPS ON GIVING.JHO, lAWRENCEVILLE, GA.

Reviews.Title: Good price, low quality pictures
Reviews.Author: M. Rogers
Reviews.Content: Excellent outdoors picture quality, poor indoors use. Pictures taken with flash indoors turn out grainy or distorted.Warranty poor.I just bought the new CANON POWER SHOT SX200IS.GREAT GREAT GREATYou just can't mess up the pictures. Wonderful ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Great price, nice camera
Reviews.Author: RKissel "RKissel"
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 2 week vacation with this camera and was very happy with it.  8MP is plenty for the type of photography I do.  The 7x zoom matches my old Olympus 320, and is very handy.  I do miss the viewfinder since using the screen outside is really hard.  You kind of have to look for bright parts in the scene and try to find them on the screen and then "guess" on composition since you really can't see any details, or much more than light and dark.  I'm going to look for some sort of after-market hood for the screen since that would help, I think.  I miss any sort of manual exposure or shutter speed control, but the camera seemed to pick pretty good exposures most of the time.  I'm going to try using the spot-metering to "fine tune" the exposures (since you can point at something to get the exposure you want and then lock it with a half button push).  The histogram is nice.  I got used to the sliding door lens cover, but it is pretty easy to bump open in your pocket, so be careful.  Since the lens is near one side, you have to be careful to keep your fingers out of the way, especially when shooting vertically (at least I had trouble with that).  The battery life seemed reasonable (a few hundred pictures, some with flash, and some playback) and it charged fairly quickly.  I didn't do anything with movies or sound recording, so I can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: amazing photos for the price
Reviews.Author: aptos
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my teenage daughter to photograph wolves. The zoom was incredible, and one of her close-ups photos was posted on a website. That photo beat out a number of photos taken with more expensive cameras.She's also taken indoor photos for a local animal rescue site, and the photos are perfect. I'm amazed at the negative reviews. The camera beats my Sony Cybershot for quality.

Reviews.Title: great camera ..does everything...i like all its features and it is easy to use
Reviews.Author: T. bohannon "petunia"
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera...easy to use and many many features..I like that i can edit the pics on the camera...my sister likes hers too...

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio z10
Reviews.Author: M California "M"
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace one of the same.  Delivered on time & works so far, so good...

Reviews.Title: everyday camera
Reviews.Author: William M. Whelan
Reviews.Content: I really like this little camera.  It's great for carrying in a pocket and having at a moment's notice.  I love the way it works, sliding open the lens cover to turn on, zooming with no lens protruding.  I would say the camera was perfect except that it's photos are not quite as vivid as a heavier Kodak that I carry to special events, but cannot put in my pocket.The rechargeable battery is a very nice accessory, and a cost saver.I have had no problem with the camera, enjoy using it, and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Grab One While You Can!
Reviews.Author: Marcia Moore
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and for less than $100, you can't go wrong. I was able to get mine for $89.I've had it for less than a week, but have been snapping pictures every day with it. It's tiny and fits in a pocket, yet the buttons are very easy to handle. I've had no issue with noise in darker rooms, and even if I did, there are software programs to clear it right up.The menu options and picture taking modes are all simple and self explanatory. Anybody can pick up this camera and come out with crystal clear, vivid photos.Battery life isn't terrific, so grab an extra or two. Just a hint: you don't have to use the Pentax brand battery. You can find a 3.7V 700mAH for a fraction of the cost if you do a little searching. I found them for 21 cents each. They work great.

Reviews.Title: Pentax camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy Robertson
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice camera. It doesn't have a lot ofbuilt-in memory but I got an SD card to make up for thelack. The quality of the pictures is pretty good and ittakes moving pictures surprisingly well. All in all, I'mhappy with it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT affordable Camera!
Reviews.Author: Raquel W.
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how many features this camera has! I love that it has a slim design. There are so many great shooting modes! And Photo editing features built right into the camera!The only downside to the camera that I've noticed so far is that it doesn't take night time pictures very well, or record night time video well.I would highly recommend this camera !

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: eurich0301
Reviews.Content: nice features, very slim camera and no protruding lens. Must read the manual to fully understand the features. Where can you see a camera with 8MP 7X optical zoom with this kind of slim camera, with a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for travel
Reviews.Author: B. Getty
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my husband to travel to Indonesia into the rain forest for work.  He is a paramedic and loved the 7x zoom, the fact that the camera is water resistant is helpful in the rainforest enviroment that he is traveling in.  The small compact design and great price all were factors in our buying this camera.  We first saw it at [...] but item was sold out when we went to purchase it so i found it on Amazon and was very happy with the price and service.

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: E. Heroux "maeroux"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality was terrible. I tried several different functions but every picture I took was very grainy. Also the slider that turns the camera on and off moves way too easily.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio Z10
Reviews.Author: Fred R. Long "Old Man"
Reviews.Content: It serves my purpose. Without the extending lens, it fits on CCTV bracket to mount for my windshield. Batteries don't last very long at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: A. Carrato "Hummingbird"
Reviews.Content: It's my first digital camera and I can't imagine a better camera.  It meets all my simple needs. The picture is bright, clear, and has accurate colors. It's so easy to use - not complicated.  I am very pleased with my purchase. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Needs some vibrancy to the colors
Reviews.Author: Clay45
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price and I do like the extended zoom capability.  However, the pictures are not as vibrant as my Canon A-95.

Reviews.Title: Pentax z10
Reviews.Author: Jay A. Sargent
Reviews.Content: This product to date has met all my expecations in terms of size, ease of use, mobility, and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: If you take indoor pictures, don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: William Orange
Reviews.Content: It's very simple. You can only use this camera outdoors (in enough light). Indoor pictures are EXTREMELY grainy. I know how to use a digital camera and this one is terrible. Please read the bad reviews on Amazon before purchasing!

Reviews.Title: Compact Quality
Reviews.Author: Roger G. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I really like the compact design for its mobility. Also the built in 7X optical zoom produces high quality closeups as well as clear distance shots.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pat Peterson
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace Sony that was stolen. Great camera.  Takes unbelievable pictures, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: L. Meister "retsiem"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Optio Z10 from a salesman that assured me this was THE camera to be used on my frequent excursions in the outdoors. I loved the fact that the lens did not extend from the camera body (1 less moving part) what I did not realize is that the LCD screen is so fragile, it cracked while in the camera case on my belt. Having bought an extended warranty I was informed Pentax would not cover the damage. I wasted $300.00 on the camera and warranty and was given very poor service in the repair shop. Don't be a sucker like I was and buy a good product from a responsible company.

Reviews.Title: Promising specs, Poor quality
Reviews.Author: A. Nir
Reviews.Content: I love pentax.With my previous pocket pentax (optio 550) had amazing pictures, but the promising Z10 was a bad bet, which I regret.If you are looking for a large zoom, get the panasonic lumix.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: cez "cez"
Reviews.Content: I owned an optio s5z a 5mp camera and the picture quality was better and the optio z10 an 8mp camera, pictures to grainy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: P. Holladay "Teancums_Boy"
Reviews.Content: The shipping was extremely quick.  The product is everything I expected.  A great gift.
